name: Thilanka Resort and Spa

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as part of a tour. When we arrived we thought the surroundings looked beautiful. The hotel reception/pool area is a little odd though. Although we arrived at 4pm we were told that our rooms were not ready. After 20 minutes one room was available, but we had to wait a further 20 minutes for the second room.
reviews.title: A disappointment from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are lovely, nicely decorated and huge windows around the room. The bathrooms though are uncomfortable and made of stone. Outside there is also a bath, but it was too made of stone and full of bugs. We did have to change one of the rooms too, as the smell from the bathroom was repulsive. When changed we were given a smaller room with no TV/DVD and no minibar. The bathroom light in this one did not work either.
reviews.title: Paradise between mango trees and rice field

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were half board, and the evening meal was terrible. It was 4 courses and all western, there was no Sri Lankan food at all which was a disappointment. Our starter of a prawn salad had one prawn on it, which was overcooked and chewy. The second started was vegetable soup, but this was merely veg stock. Then the main course or with pork or fish looked terribly haute cuisine ie not much to eat! It lacked flavour aswell. The dessert was nothing special. We actually went back to our rooms feeling very hungry! Breakfast the next morning looked promising, but all the cooked foods like eggs, bacon etc were stone cold. I asked the chef for toast but the waiter delivered it to the wrong table. Again we left feeling very hungry.
reviews.title: tranquil surroundings, a sanctuary for the senses !
Could be wonderful
reviews.text: The staff were pretty clueless and not just because of their lack of english.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left this hotel in a hurry, which was disapponting as it initially looked really nice.
reviews.title: Average...but could be better

likes.liked: — The infinity pool...had it all to myself

reviews.title: A truly Sri Lankan experience
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Thilanka Resort and Spa on the 12th of October and it was a truly satisfying stay for us. We enjoyed the welcome drink (which was fresh guava juice I think) and then the room was also very spacious and comfortable with our very own plunge pool (which we never expected!)

The greatest surprise was how they served lunch. We were served a tempered rice in a lotus leaf which was very authentic, very Sri Lankan. It was like going back in time in these days of ultra modernization. They are also implementing home gardening and also served us fresh garden produce.We had a truly wonderful day at the resort. We would like to thank the staff for their pleasant service. We will definitely visit again.
reviews.title: Potentially wonderful

description: Boutique hotel- 24 luxury Suites with AC, fan, TV, DVD, mini bar, safe, telephone, WIFI, jacuzzi or plunge pool. Ayurveda spa, restaurant, bar, swimming pool, tennis and colleyball located in a 25 acre orchard with 2 rivers.
